intro: Silene greuteri, commonly known as the Sierra Nevada silene, is a flowering plant native to the western United States, particularly in the Sierra Nevada mountain range. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family, characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as meadows and forest understories. Silene greuteri has linear to lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It is an important species for pollinators and contributes to the biodiversity of its native ecosystems.
